pageContext.claim: “We had the slowest recovery in history, or I guess since the depression, since the Great Depression, and we were heading down.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump routinely tries to take credit for jobs created since the election, even though Obama was still president, yet here he calls economic growth in the first quarter of his presidency "Obama's last quarter." Moreover, Trump falsely claims "we were headed down" when in fact he inherited an economy that already had the longest period of unbroken job growth in U.S. history. All of the economic trends that are promising under Trump's administration began under Obama's.
